poem:
**Market Simmer**

In ticker-tape whispers, markets exhale,  
tailwinds of shutdown tranquilly tamed.  
Goldman murmurs of bubbles unblown,  
AI dreams huddle at pinprick's edge.

Digits dance on the FTSE's crest,  
not yet an illusion, not yet a jest.  
In this stilled pulse, calm currents flow,  
where commerce hums but fears don't show.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "FTSE 100 near record high as US shutdown breakthrough sparks market rally – business live 11.45am GMT Goldman Sachs: we are not yet clearly in AI bubble territory The question of whether artificial intelligence stocks are in a dangerous bubble has been gripping markets for weeks – analysts at Goldman Sachs, though, argue they are not. In a research note issued yesterday afternoon, they make the case that vauations are not dangerously high, yet anyway.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: FTSE 100 near record high as US shutdown breakthrough sparks market rally – business live 11.45am GMT Goldman Sachs: we are not yet clearly in AI bubble territory The question of whether artificial intelligence stocks are in a dangerous bubble has been gripping markets for weeks – analysts at Goldman Sachs, though, argue they are not. In a research note issued yesterday afternoon, they make the case that vauations are not dangerously high, yet anyway.
